page.title: 01BURRINGTON VILLAGE
page.content: Burrington village stands on high ground, approached by steep lanes with high hedges. At the centre of the village is the Square with its ancient oak tree, the church, the chapel, the shop, the Post Office, the Barnstaple Inn, Pickard's Store, the Green and the Primary School. The parish covers 25 square miles, and is bounded to the North and East by the{River Taw,}and to the South by the Mully Brook. The highest point is 201 metres, on Burrington Moor. There are{views to Exmoor and Dartmoor}from many places in the parish. The main occupation is farming: sheep, cattle and some arable. There are{388 electors.}Burrington is in the North Devon constituency, the North Devon District, and the South Molton Rural District. It has its own Parish Council.
